intro: Tomanthea microlopha, commonly known as the small-lobed tomanthea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, lobed leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
